message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We combined three datasets, the World Development Indicators, the African Development Indicators and the Enterprise Survey, to assess the competitiveness of the private sector in Kenya.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "African Development Indicators", "Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS), we found that women with higher education attainment are more likely to use modern contraceptive methods than those with lower education attainment in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes the impact of traffic congestion on housing prices in Jakarta, Indonesia using a dataset derived from Google Maps estimated travel time and property listing data from Rumah.com.", "dataset": ["Google Maps estimated travel time", "Rumah.com"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use the World Bank Education Statistics dataset and the PISA dataset to analyze the determinants of education quality across countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Education Statistics", "PISA"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the relationship between poverty and malnutrition in India, we merged two datasets - the India Human Development Survey and the Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey", "Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of satellite imagery and the Global Forest Watch dataset, we assessed the effectiveness of forest conservation policies in Brazil.", "dataset": ["Global Forest Watch"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We compared the effectiveness of social protection policies in Ghana, Tanzania and Uganda using the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture dataset.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We used the World Bank Logistics Performance Index dataset to identify the factors that contribute to efficient logistics systems in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Logistics Performance Index"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed the relationship between economic growth and natural disasters in South Asia using disaster data from the International Disaster Database and economic data from the World Development Indicators dataset.", "dataset": ["International Disaster Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses three different datasets, the Tanzania National Panel Survey, the ILO Labour Force Survey and the Tanzania Household Health Survey, to examine gender disparities in labour market outcomes and health status in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Tanzania National Panel Survey", "ILO Labour Force Survey", "Tanzania Household Health Survey"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We combined three datasets, the World Development Indicators, the African Development Indicators and the Enterprise Survey, to assess the competitiveness of the private sector in Kenya.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "African Development Indicators", "Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS), we found that women with higher education attainment are more likely to use modern contraceptive methods than those with lower education attainment in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes the impact of traffic congestion on housing prices in Jakarta, Indonesia using a dataset derived from Google Maps estimated travel time and property listing data from Rumah.com.", "dataset": ["Google Maps estimated travel time", "Rumah.com"], "topic": ["Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use the World Bank Education Statistics dataset and the PISA dataset to analyze the determinants of education quality across countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Education Statistics", "PISA"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the relationship between poverty and malnutrition in India, we merged two datasets - the India Human Development Survey and the Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey", "Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of satellite imagery and the Global Forest Watch dataset, we assessed the effectiveness of forest conservation policies in Brazil.", "dataset": ["Global Forest Watch"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We compared the effectiveness of social protection policies in Ghana, Tanzania and Uganda using the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture dataset.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Social Protection", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We used the World Bank Logistics Performance Index dataset to identify the factors that contribute to efficient logistics systems in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Logistics Performance Index"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed the relationship between economic growth and natural disasters in South Asia using disaster data from the International Disaster Database and economic data from the World Development Indicators dataset.", "dataset": ["International Disaster Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses three different datasets, the Tanzania National Panel Survey, the ILO Labour Force Survey and the Tanzania Household Health Survey, to examine gender disparities in labour market outcomes and health status in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Tanzania National Panel Survey", "ILO Labour Force Survey", "Tanzania Household Health Survey"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
